Russia secretly recorded Boston bombing suspect

US: Wiretap recently shared

Russian authorities secretly recorded a conversation in 2011 in which one of the Boston bombing suspects vaguely discussed jihad with his mother, US officials said. (5:20 p.m.)

Officials: No sign 'Misha' tied to bombing

Investigators have found no evidence that a conservative Muslim friend of Tamerlan Tsarnaev had any connection to the Boston Marathon bombing, US officials said. (5:29 p.m.)

Pictures: Beautiful scenes from Italy heal Boston

Pictured is Porto Venere, which is located in Italy’s Liguria region.
 Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
Chef Lillian offered appetizers in Montelpuciano, which is located in southern Tuscany. Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
A view of a landscape in the Cinque Terra region of Italy.
Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
A view of a blooming landscape in the Cinque Terra region of Italy.
Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
A view of the mountains near Vernazza in Cinque Terre.
 Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
A woman relaxed on the steps near the Duomo in Siena.
 Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
Boats are seen docked in Vernazza. Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff

Globe photographer Stan Grossfeld was vacationing in Italy in the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombings. Feeling powerless, he turned his camera lens on his beautiful surroundings to create some “photo therapy” for Boston.
